description: Ensures equality before law and equal protection of laws
enforcement: Can be enforced through writ petitions under Article 32 (Supreme Court) or Article 226 (High Courts)

description: Includes freedom of speech, assembly, association, movement, residence, and profession
enforcement: Enforceable through constitutional remedies and judicial review

description: Prohibits trafficking, forced labor, and child labor
enforcement: Enforced through criminal law and constitutional remedies

description: Freedom to practice, profess, and propagate religion
enforcement: Protected through constitutional remedies and secular principles

description: Right to conserve culture and establish educational institutions
enforcement: Enforced through constitutional remedies and minority rights
